storyInfo: The ragtag group defeats the newly-spawned Seaborn, but Amaia and Ulpianus have their own plans. The mysterious legacy of the legendary shipwright is within arm's reach, but Gladiia senses kin that have separated from the many.

attributes.content: I see it.
I see Alfonso heading to the great hall every day. He's named it 'Iberia.'
He's moved the mirror from his bedroom to the hall, and spends day after day examining himself.
Ever since the head chef and young Jamie were executed, he and I are the only ones left.
There you are.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: How long was I asleep? Feels like I barely got any rest before I found myself awake.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Uhh... Not long... But...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: No need to force yourself. I know it hurts when you talk.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: These lowly monsters leave plenty of blood behind, so let's use that to write instead.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: I nod. In the corner are buckets, filled with the blood of our quarry.
Time passes too slowly. I barely slept at all, but my dreams felt even longer than all the decades behind us...
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Is it time we gave up then? It's been a long, long while since young Jamie and the old chef left us. Should we follow them?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: We should give up.
My consciousness blurs more and more, like the feeling of being entangled right before waking from a dream.
It is not just my flesh that is changing, but everything about me. Everything that makes me a living being.
We should give up. We should end ourselves before we're devoured. The infinite, boundless ocean. The sea breeze. The waves. The whispers.
...Chief Mate, this is our ship. Our ideals.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Sooner or later, we'll lose even the strength to walk. But that won't happen to her. Not the Stultifera Navis.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: That cigar-chomping engineer was right. Even if we all die, this ship will never sink.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Today... is just another twenty-four hours in one long, unending day.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ... (Scrawls some words using the blood of Sea Terrors)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Don't... give up?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Hah! Look at what you've become. I can't even see your sea-blue eyes anymore. Wouldn't you rather be set free?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Scrawls) I am your chief mate.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: For... your sake...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Hush, easy now.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Thank you, Garcia. No matter what you turn into, the bond between us will never change.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: But I know. He is looking at the mirror. Because even someone as strong as him... has finally succumbed to the monsters.
We have consumed their flesh and blood. At first, we started fires to cook them. Then, we were forced to devour them raw.
Even the most powerful Inquisitors were awed by Alfonso's strength. He was the object of so many young sailors' admiration. There was nothing he couldn't do.
But he has held on long enough. Soon, he too will become one of the monsters.
He is worried. He is furious.
If he cannot even tolerate the slightest monster within him, how can he tolerate me?
Trash. You're worth even less than the weed that washed ashore in Sal Viento. That woman was merely creating a smokescreen.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The ocean boasts no changes to speak of.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: ...I want to see. Are you free?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Friends are here. They are trapped. Need help. Should be returned to our kin's embrace.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Many friends have died here. But Parents. Will not let them die. I must save them.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Even if you can speak with that ugly mug of yours, that's no surprise to anyone.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Return to the great sea. No need to fight.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: We go, together—
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I've already grown tired of your prattling. Time to end you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: ...Gla-dia, will you prey on me?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: If you feed on me, will that make you stronger? More full of life?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Will it help the scales on your neck grow and spread, and return you to your proper form?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.text: Abyssal Hunters are bound by blood.
The Seaborn contorts its relatively slender form. It is—
—biting off parts of its own body.

attributes.content: I sever... this flesh. Consume it.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: If you need more, I give you more. I will give you everything.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Gladiia stares blankly at the fleshy mass on the ground.
She is shaken.
But not because of the Seaborn, or its behavior.
However, this moment of distraction convinces the Seaborn that Gladiia has accepted its proposal.
...We will meet again soon.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: The Seaborn leaves, the Gladiia does not pursue it.
Because she smells the scents of Shark and Skadi. The Seaborn will not escape.
She turns around, and heads towards where another smell is coming from.
The smell of the sea... and of blood. The smell of Hunters. Aboard the ship? And I didn't notice it until I got this close?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Impossible!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: What... What do we do now?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Never expected there'd be people alive here. I thought we'd get the ship back just by killing some Sea Terrors. The Captain made it sound so simple.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What are you looking at, Specter?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: The mirror.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Did you know, Skadi? Even as we speak, when I look at myself in this mirror, I start to remember so many things that I'd forgotten.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: A darkened dome. A hundred-meter tall sculpture. An aquamarine-colored opera hall. A waterfall pouring crystals of ice. What is this place, Skadi?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...Your home.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: My home... I remember now.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Writhing flesh climbing all over that statue. It collapses with a thunderous thud.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I remember these things, but... But I've never experienced them.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Dunno. I only know it from hearing you talk about where you used to live, which fell into ruin long ago. Long before I met you.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Maybe you only saw the report later on.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Can we save the chatter for some other time?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Were we planning to chase down those two Seaborn, or are we seizing control of the ship while they're not around and, uh, sailing it back?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: If the survivors haven't managed it in sixty years, somehow I doubt we could figure it out ourselves.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Just be patient. The squad leader will figure something out... Ugh.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Specter! What's wrong?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Just... a little dizzy.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I just remembered... what they did to me. I...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I saw her just now in Gran Faro...?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: She was willing to talk to me. She was full of hypocrisy, blowing hot and cold, but she...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: She's here.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: What... You mean more survivors?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: No, an enemy. One who can cross the sea and board this vessel, which is more than enough to identify them.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Let's split up. Where will you go?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I am an Iberian Inquisitor. It is my duty to ensure that this ship returns to Iberia's hands.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I'll go after that— after Alfonso!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Slithers away hastily)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: Gahh—!
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Oh, don't you worry, Garcia. We'll catch up soon enough.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: When those ignorant Ægirs wounded it, it went up through Victoria, and past Bolívar. From there, it could only climb up onto the deck, then dive into the sea.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: This ship is not at its beck and call.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...Leithanien. When we were young, we visited that country along with some other officers. Do you still remember?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The twisted faces of those Kurfürsten were enough to turn stomachs. But they understood how to respect Arts, which was a mind-boggling revelation...
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Hmm...?
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Today's been a good day. We saw quite a few living people. Hope they get out quickly though.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Go. Go to 'Leithanien,' Garcia. Go play the scores you used to love so much.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Breathe some life into the hunt, my love.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Hrgh—!
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: You, are not scaleless. Do you need food?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Encircling slithering sounds)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: Sufficient nutrition. But these waters, are still incomplete. The Cycle has not yet been built, and living things die in vain.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: We must hurry—
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: —Why? Hunting, meaningless. There is something we must do, a duty to our kin.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: How many does that make now? Lost track after ten. When'd you monsters learn how to talk?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Ohh... No, I remember you, little one. When we ate your parents, you and your litter were nearby, watching.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Back then, you were the weakest of the lot. Pathetic runt.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Alfonso laughs as he pokes at the Seaborn's wound, blood running along the tip of his blade and dripping onto the floor.
We are bound by blood. You hunt and eat us, you will become us. Just as our Parents hunted you, and then became hunted by you.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: If the right conditions can trigger your evolution, then how do we make you more palatable? Your flesh, that is.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: To hunt is to survive. There is no good or evil in the hunt.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: That's too bad then.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The scent trail... ends here.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: He led me here. This smell...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Gladiia does not search for the Hunter's whereabouts.
She begins to look around her.
Ever since she boarded this vessel, her surroundings have filled her with a sense of nostalgia—the materials, the decorations, the handiwork.
Breogan, a genius from the Academy of Sciences, was an Ægir. Without a doubt, this was his domain.
The mystery behind why this ship hadn't sunk in decades was itself the message Breogan wanted to leave to the Ægir. A brand new fusion of Originium and terrestrial technologies.
But what exactly is it?
Gladiia grasps the key from her bosom.
She sizes up her surroundings.
Breogan... Where did you hide your secrets?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: (Why would this ship be built like a palace?! Most of it is decorative, and there are even sculptures.)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (No, that's not all. Both the sculptures and the patterned carpets have been cleaned. Even under these conditions?)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (The sound of music wafts in from the distance)
...Someone's playing the piano?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: It's coming from over here!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Irene's footsteps slow down.
At the end of the corridor, through a crack in the door, she sees—
—A single Seaborn, slapping away at a dilapidated old piano.
(It's that Seaborn that was next to Alfonso! But what is it doing here?)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Cheerfully slaps at the piano)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Ugh, what a ruckus... It's just pounding away at the keyboard with no rhyme or reason.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Alfonso isn't here... Did he go after the Seaborn? Why is his chief mate here alone then?)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Well, I won't worry about it for now.)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: —What?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (That melody just now, was that a coincidence? It certainly looks like it's only randomly smashing the keys.)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (No... It stopped?)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...The seashore... O, the seashore...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Farewell to heroes... and... great men...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: —! Hiss...!
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: The Chief Mate turns its head in fear. Fear. Fear is what Irene sees in its behavior.
A massive, inexplicable physical reaction. One that's never been displayed in front of a Hunter before.
Just now, you weren't just randomly hitting keys...?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: That... passage you played. An Iberian military song...? You... how?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Urgh...!
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Y-You're still conscious? Do you still have memories of being human? Do you know who you are?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: But, no... You're already fully transformed. The Inquisition has dealt with cultists like that before. There's no reversing it.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Wh-What are you planning? What are you doing with your hand?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Carefully places its hand atop Irene's head)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: What... What is the meaning of this?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Through the scraps of cloth reminiscent of a wedding veil, the Seaborn known as the chief mate watches Irene.
Its pupils are cloudy. It is suffering. It—
—is filled with both affection and nostalgia.
You... If you truly retain a shred of your humanity...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: But how, after all these years...?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Cap... tain...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Wh-What's happening?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Wait!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Hunt, feed. But that is not what you are doing. Your goal is constantly changing. Shaking. Yes, shaking.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Tch.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: You should just keep playing your piano, Garcia. You don't need to be touching these—
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Lightly shakes head)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Then sink your teeth into it. Its body is changing. Finish it now.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: You are... not hungry.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Alfonso doesn't answer the Seaborn's question. He simply chops and hacks at it again and again, like meat on a cutting board.
The chief mate bites down on the Seaborn in a death grip. Its crown falls to the ground during the struggle, but it does not care to pick it up.
Alfonso cuts off the Seaborn's tentacles, which join the crown on the ground. The chief mate pauses for a moment.
Ah... Garcia, Garcia.
Look at your crown, and at that tentacle. Do you understand what you've become now?
...Leave. We will meet again.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Garcia!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The chief mate lifts its head, but the Seaborn has already vanished without a trace.
It quietly picks up its crown, and places it back on its head before returning to Alfonso's side. As if apologizing, it gently rubs his hand.
...Are you hurt, my good chief mate? Or were you distracted by our uninvited guests?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The chief mate does not answer.
It dares not speak. It dares not say that when it was biting down into the enemy, it felt like it was 'tearing into its own kin.'
It dares not speak, and after once again realizing what it has become, it begins to feel guilt.
...If you still have room for emotions in your heart, then that is proof enough that you're still human. Remember young Jamie's last words? 'I have no remorse, no regrets, and no fear.'
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Only when you truly feel nothing will you lose the right to call yourself human.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Don't worry. The next hunt will be quick, and as always, it WILL return.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Lightly shakes head)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Herald.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: ...Kin. Scaleless?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You are badly wounded. A newborn like you should not have been in a hurry to board this ship.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Kin are here. In need of help.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Indeed, true enough. But you've been hurt. Though they are kin, they do not welcome you.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: They have not yet accepted their identity. They are still lost and confused.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Accept? Identity?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: ...You do not need to understand. These waters are still incomplete. Perhaps you will have to further perfect yourself before you can lead our entire kind.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Need time. And nutrition.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: And I've come to give you both.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: That blasphemous sea captain slaughtered Sea Terrors for food, but used every means available to hinder the transformation. He's usurped pieces of the Cycle, yet refuses to be a part of it.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: The flesh and blood of those offspring rightfully belonged to you. Those nutrients were meant to be yours. This ship has delayed the birth of a brand new ecosystem.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Please do not abandon me, Herald. In due time, all of Terra will become one and the same with the Nest.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I do not abandon. Kin.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I need time. But not much more.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I will be back. We will meet again.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I could have sworn you were going to rush over and kill us.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Should I be thanking you, Ulpianus?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I can kill something like whenever I want. It's even weaker than Quintus.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: How patient of you.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Gladiia also tried to infiltrate the Church of the Deep in Sal Viento, hoping to get something out of them. Of course, she was a poor fit, given her personality.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: And here I was thinking that none of you were a good fit. Or are you saying you're special?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You're getting less and less tight-lipped of late.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Heh. I suppose there's really no rhyme or reason for when you decide to keep quiet, Ulpianus.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Don't use my given name so casually, Liberi. You don't understand the weight behind it.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: We are enemies.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Oh, we both know you've already abandoned that notion, deep in your heart. Of course, you might still hold some 'enmity.'
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Like a lost and famished traveler who stumbles on a frozen, starving mangler-beast in the mountains.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Did whatever Breogan left behind satisfy your imagination?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Far from it.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The Seaborn have existed for even longer than the Ægir. For their history to be turned upside-down, there must be something behind it.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: If you care about the word of God, then so be it. The Seaborn are not gods, nor are their forefathers.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I have seen how your gods die, their screams coursing through the currents, their flesh and blood smeared across abyssal ravines. As the clan hovered overhead, I plunged into the unknown depths of Ægir's territory.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I've seen it with my own eyes. Enough to shatter all the beliefs I'd held thus far. Afterwards, I will rebuild it. Ægir will be lifted up once more.
attributes.name: Ulpianus
